definition: to honor sb as a God (idiom); to revere/to worship/to deify/to make a holy cow of sth/to put sb on a pedestal
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to seem/like/as/if
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: His pronouncements were cited with awe by our Chinese hosts.
sentences.chinese: 我們的中國東道主們對他的每句話都奉若神明。

sentences.english: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans.
sentences.chinese: 瓦倫蒂諾幾乎被衆多的女性崇拜者奉若神明。
他們不再把偉大領袖奉若神明。

sentences.english: This kind of method is regarded as the gods, making traditional Wushu in dying edge.
sentences.chinese: 這種奉若神明的做法，使傳統武術處在垂死的邊緣。

definition: to hold sb in the same regard as one would a god (idiom)
to prostrate oneself in worship (idiom)/(fig.) to worship/to bow down to
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to admire/to revere/to look up to
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to treat sb favorably/to view in a new light
deeply grateful
to follow obediently
to address sb deferentially/title/honorific
to believe firmly without any doubt (idiom)/absolute certainty about sth
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to revere/to venerate/high esteem
to revere/highly esteemed
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)
